comment: Easiest class I have ever taken. I would take online to give you a break. Ms. Ma is so kind and the class is chill. Take it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Weekly 350 word discussion posts about documentaries or podcasts and readings. Pay attention to your team due dates of when you comment and when you respond. 2 film reviews guidelines can be unclear. Easy class but make sure to read ahead. No tests, quizzes, or finals.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: This professor was so genuine and caring towards the class. We had a student that wrote triggering discussion posts every week and the professor was quick to email the class and explain that she was aware of the racism. Her readings were all very interesting and insightful. It was a great class despite having a not-so-great classmate.

This was an easy and interesting course. Professor Ma has a clear grading policy and follows the rubrics for each assignment. The workload is fair, not too much or too little. You will be required to complete 6 discussion posts and 6 discussion replies, as well as 2 film reviews. There is no final exam.

She really cares about what she does. She is the sweetest person, and I highly recommend her. You have a discussion every week and two film reviews. The lectures she provides really help you understand the film and text you have to read that week.

Dr. Ma was incredibly knowledgeable and always wanted to hear what we had to say in class. She has very interesting lectures as well as interesting stories pertaining to her lectures. This class is just Asian queer theory, but she relates it to other cultures as well and its very interesting. Amazing professor, 10/10
Dr. Ma is very caring and will help you through the semester if you are confused. Overall a very easy class that I would take again.

This professor is super laidback but you do learn a lot in the class if you read the materials. Weekly discussion posts and then a final essay and presentation are the makeup of your grade other than attendance.

This professor is super laidback but you do learn a lot in the class if you read the materials. Weekly discussion posts and then a final essay and presentation are the makeup of your grade other than attendance. My attendance wasn't the best and I still made an A.

The course mostly consists of weekly readings and in-class discussion. There is no final exam, but there's a final essay where you can choose just about anything relating to what you have learned throughout the semester. Good professor.

Professor Ma was very kind and cared a lot about her students. No tests, midterm, or final. All grades came from attendance, discussion posts, and the final project/essay. She is not a harsh grader, so don't worry about doing badly so long as you show up and participate and do all the assignments.
Halfway through the semester, we went fully online but prior to that she took attendance and emphasized participation. Great lady overall and an easy grader but has very few assignments.

Dr Ma was the sweetest professor. Very understanding and truly cares about her students. She made class fun by talking about interesting topics and allowing everyone to voice their opinion. There are some discussions you can choose from along with 2 papers and some reading worksheets. overall a lovely class and an easy A.

There were readings assigned every weekend but you don't have to do all of them. There are no tests - just 2 papers that she basically outlines for you. Literally almost impossible to fail this class. Its so cool - literally considered changing my major bc of this professor.
Absolutely amazing!!! Very chill, simple work. Take this class.

She is such an amazing person and her class makes you really rethink certain topics you thought you knew. She genuinely cares about her students. When I was having a rough time she offered me many resources. Take her! You won't regret it.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! You have homework that requires you to read but once you get the hang of the reading worksheets (which are in the same format every week) it is simple to do. 2 papers that are opinion-based. 14 readings but only have to do 10 and 6 discussion posts. She is so understanding about the college student's busy schedule. TAKE HER!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Ma is SUPER nice and really wants her students to succeed. She has interesting lectures and course materials and does not require a lot of assignments.

Professor Ma was a really good professor to have for this subject, she is very passionate about teaching and making sure that the students are involved in her lectures as well. There is some reading to do each week, but it's not hard and your main grades come from 2 essays, which are easy. She is very understanding and wants everyone to pass.

Not sure why more people wouldn't take Professor Ma again. This class can be an easy A if you read the textbook and participate every once in awhile in class. I loved this class a lot, but be prepared to literally be talking about love and sex. Pretty cool class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very sweet professor and will work with you when it comes to grades and due dates. Participation does matter because it's a pretty large portion of your grade, so showing up will either make or break your grade.

She wasn't the worst professor I've had, but not the best. Her lectures aren't very orderly and often seems like she doesn't know what she is doing. Work load is easy and doable. She's willing to work with you on grades and wants you to do well. Nice overall, but I didn't learn much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.
